text: Yasser Saeed Al-Qahtani (; born 10 October 1982) is a former Saudi Arabian footballer who plays as a striker. He currently retired for Al-Hilal in Saudi Professional League. He was also captain of the Saudi Arabian national team. In 2005, he moved to Al-Hilal for 23 million Saudi riyal. He is married since 2008 and has a son "Abdulaziz" born in 1/1/2010. ==Club career statistics== Club Season League Crown Prince Cup King Cup ACL Other Total Apps Goals Assists Apps Goals Assists Apps Goals Assists Apps Goals Assists Apps Goals Assists Apps Goals Assists Al-Qadisiya 2002–03 10 5 2 0 12 5 2003–04 17 9 1 0 18 9 2004–05 14 5 4 3 2 1 18 8 Total 41 19 7 3 2 1 50 23 Al-Hilal 2005–06 13 7 - 5 1 - - - - - - - 0 0 0 18 8 2006–07 16 10 - 4 0 - - - - 6 1 - 4 3 - 30 14 2007–08 16 10 - 4 3 - 3 0 - 3 0 - - - - 26 13 2008–09 16 10 - 4 1 - 3 0 - 5 2 - - - - 28 13 2009–10 20 9 - 4 2 - 4 4 - 8 5 - - - - 36 20 2010–11 16 11 - 3 2 - - - - 5 4 - - - - 24 17 2012–13 30 13 - 8 1 - 0 - - 9 2 - 0 - - 47 16 2013–14 16 5 - 2 2 - 0 - - 7 2 - 0 - - 25 9 Total 143 75 - 34 12 - 11 4 - 43 16 - 4 3 - 235 110 -!- Al-Ain FC 2011–12 12 7 - 6 5 - 0 - - 0 - - 5 3 - 23 15 Total 12 7 6 5 23 15 Career Total 196 101 - 40 18 - 11 4 - 43 16 - 11 7 - 308 148 - ==Honours== ===Country=== *Arab Nations Cup: Winner 2002 *Gulf Cup of Nations: Winner 2003 *AFC Asian Cup: Runners-up 2007 *Gulf Cup of Nations: Runners-up 2009 ;Club *Saudi Professional League: 2008, 2010, 2011 *Crown Prince Cup: 2006, 2008, 2009, 2010, 2011, 2012, 2013 * Saudi Federation cup: 2006 * Match World Cup: 2011 ==References== ==Other websites== * * Category:1982 births Category:Living people Category:Saudi Arabian footballers Category:People from Riyadh Category:Al Hilal SFC players
